chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must contact Department of Corrections today, 8/26/2022.

miscConds.notes: AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must maintain absolute sobriety. May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Court instructs Defendant to attend the next Job Fair and provides a flyer. Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail Monday-Friday, between 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM, by 9/9/2022, to submit DNA sample.

$250.00 cash bond applied. Financial obligations are due within 60 days of the sentence date. The Barron County Clerk of Courts shall collect all financial obligations. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt. Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 2 days credit if revoked from Probation.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew L Miller

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Defendant Matthew L Miller in court.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Matthew L Miller.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reporter appeared by zoom.
Attorney Davis relates.  10:29 Court in recess 11:03 Case recalled.  Attorney Davis relates.  State moves to amend Count 4 to obstructing 946.41(1) - a Class A misdemeanor.  Court grants amendment.  Court performs plea colloquy.  Guilty plea entered to Counts 1 and 4.  Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Counts 2 and 3 are Dismissed and Read In.  State relates.  Attorney Davis relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 2 years Probation - Must contact Department of Corrections today
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court.  Must report to the Barron County Jail Monday-Friday, between 8:00 AM and 5:00 PM, by 9/9/22, to submit DNA sample.
Court costs including domestic abuse and DNA surcharges - $250.00 cash bond to be applied - 60 DTP remainder to Clerk of Court.
2 days jail credit if Probation is revoked.

Court instructs Defendant to attend the next Job Fair and provides flyer to Defendant.

1:16 PM Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Matthew L Miller.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 1:34 p.m. Court relates on Defendant's non-appearance and Attorney Davis has left the Zoom meeting.  State relates on plea hearing set for Friday, but does not oppose modifying the bond to no abusive contact.  Court relates on not being able to take up the bail issue at this time without the other parties present and bail hearing is to be reset.
Plea hearing on August 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew L Miller in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Matthew L Miller.
Covers 22CF22 and 20CF212

22CF22 - State and Attorney Davis request plea hearing be rescheduled.  Plea hearing to be arranged by Judge Babler's judicial assistant.

20CF212 Sentencing After Revocation - Court questions Defendant regarding Attorney Davis appearing by video. Attorney Davis makes correction to Revocation Order and Warrant. 2:10 Argument by State 2:16 Argument by Attorney Davis 2:23 Defendant relates 2:25 Court relates and orders:


Count 9:
9 months - Credit for 131 days - Good time granted - Huber or work release privileges granted

Count 11:
9 months - Concurrent to Count 9

Outstanding financial obligations reduced to civil judgment.
Defendant to submit a DNA sample if not already done previously.

11:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew L Miller appeared by  zoom video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court for Matthew L Miller. 
Information is discussed and Defendant waives reading.  

 Not guilty plea entered.    This will track with 20CF212 with Judge Bitney.  


Scan to Jail .
Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Arraignment on April 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.; sent to Defendant at BC Jail on 2/4/22

10:03 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Matthew L Miller appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Matthew L Miller.  Attorney Davis relates waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant. The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given, finds probable cause and binds over for trial.  Arraignment set and must appear in person if released from jail.
Arraignment scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.; sent to Defendant at the BC Jail on 1/27/22

09:59 AM Defendant Matthew L Miller in court by Zoom video with attorney Michael J Steuer by Zoom video for today only for Nicholas Davis.  Defendant Matthew L Miller in custody. Brian H. Wright appeared for the State of Wisconsin in court.
Attorney Steuer relates and requests reset.  Court finds good cause and resets to next week.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

Defendant must have no contact with S. M.  dob 11/16/1968.
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.

01:10 PM Defendant Matthew L Miller in court with attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow for today.  Defendant Matthew L Miller in custody.  Brian H. Wright appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matthew L Miller appeared by video means with Attorney.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint.  
AIA set to insure defendant has counsel.
State asks for $250 cash bail.
Attorney Rockow makes argument for signature bond.
Court orders cash bond.

(Bond and MS scanned to jail)
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
